definition: (of a theater) to empty/(of a show) to end
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]

sentences.english: The film was over. The students poured out in crowds.
sentences.chinese: 电影散场后学生们一群一群往外涌。

sentences.english: The child get lose in the press of people leave the match.
sentences.chinese: 在看完比赛后散场的人群中把孩子挤丢了。

sentences.english: This surely would end it, thought Tess.
sentences.chinese: 苔丝心想，这场完了就该散场了。

sentences.english: Even if the lengthy finish at youth, it still makes an infinite nostalgia.
sentences.chinese: 冗长的青春即使散场，也依然让人无限怀恋。

sentences.english: There was no after-theatre lark, however, so far as Carrie was concerned.
sentences.chinese: 然而，就嘉莉而言，不存在什么散场后的玩乐。

sentences.english: Youth will break, but memory lasts forever.
sentences.chinese: 青春终将散场，唯独记忆永垂不朽。

sentences.english: The child got lost in the press of people leaving the match.
sentences.chinese: 在看完比赛后散场的人群中把孩子挤丢了。

sentences.english: A bound, so long as the love, also should break up.
sentences.chinese: 好聚好散，捆绑了这么久的爱情，也早应该散场了。

sentences.english: He is to come here, directly after the play.
sentences.chinese: 叫他等戏一散场就直接到这里来。

sentences.english: There being no taxi, we had to walk home after the movie.
sentences.chinese: 因为没有计程车，我们在电影散场后必须走路回家。

sentences.english: Graduation, let this ridiculous youth so it after the.
sentences.chinese: 毕业了，就让这荒唐的青春这样散场吧。

definition: end of a banquet
end of a show
farewell dinner party
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
The End (appearing at the end of a movie etc)
to have eaten and drunk to one's heart's content
to close shop in the evening/also pr. [da3 yang2]
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
see 天下沒有不散的筵席|天下没有不散的筵席[tian1 xia4 mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan2 xi2]
pinyin: tian1 xia4 mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan4 xi2

definition: to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
to leave/to exit
(of a play, movie etc) to begin
all good things must come to an end (idiom)
pinyin: tian1 xia4 mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan2 xi2

definition: leave-taking/to say goodbye
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
to take a curtain call/(fig.) to come to an end
